00022 /// @file   sat_uint16.h
00023 /// @brief  Saturating 16 bit integers.
00024 
00025 #ifndef __SAT_UINT16_H_
00026 #define __SAT_UINT16_H_
00027 
00028 //! this will include stdint if possible.
00029 #include "portability/affy-base-types.h"
00030 //
00031 #include <climits>
00032 //
00033 
00034 //! A more readable name.
00035 #define SAT_UINT16_MAX USHRT_MAX
00036 
00037 //! Convert an value to fit in the range of (0,SAT_UINT16_MAX)
00038 #define SAT_CLAMP_VAL(x) ((in<0)?0:(in<SAT_UINT16_MAX)?(in):SAT_UINT16_MAX)
00039 
00040 
00041 /// @brief          A class for saturating integers.
00042 /// @param in          the value to make the sat_uint16 with.
00043 /// @remark       This avoids overflow when preforming normalization with uint16
00044 class sat_uint16 {
00045   uint16_t value;
00046 
00047  public:
00048   //! avoid a function call by using the macro
00049   //! Clamp does not assign a value, assign does.
00050   inline sat_uint16 clamp(int in) {
00051     return SAT_CLAMP_VAL(x);
00052   }
00053   inline void assign(int in) {
00054     value=SAT_CLAMP_VAL(in);
00055   }
00056 
00057   //! defaults to zero.
00058   sat_uint16()             { value=0;             }
00059   //! creation from a value
00060   sat_uint16(int   number) { assign(number);      }
00061   sat_uint16(uint64_t number) { assign((int)number); }
00062   sat_uint16(double number) { assign((int)number); }
00063   //! dont need to check range
00064   sat_uint16(const sat_uint16& number) { value=number.value; }
00065 
00066   //! Assignment from different types.
00067   sat_uint16& operator= (const double   number) { assign(int(number)); return *this; }
00068   sat_uint16& operator= (const int      number) { assign(int(number)); return *this; }
00069   sat_uint16& operator= (const uint64_t number) { assign(int(number)); return *this; }
00070 
00071   //! Basic math functions.
00072   sat_uint16 operator*(const double     number) { return clamp(int(value*number));  }
00073   sat_uint16 operator*(const int        number) { return clamp(value*number);       }
00074   sat_uint16 operator*(const sat_uint16 number) { return clamp(value*number.value); }
00075   sat_uint16 operator+(const double     number) { return clamp(int(value+number));  }
00076   sat_uint16 operator+(const int        number) { return clamp(value+number);       }
00077   sat_uint16 operator+(const sat_uint16 number) { return clamp(value+number.value); }
00078   sat_uint16 operator+(const uint64_t   number) { return clamp(int(value+number));  }
00079   sat_uint16 operator-(const double     number) { return clamp(int(value-number));  }
00080   sat_uint16 operator-(const int        number) { return clamp(value-number);       }
00081   sat_uint16 operator-(const sat_uint16 number) { return clamp(value-number.value); }
00082   sat_uint16 operator-(const uint64_t   number) { return clamp(int(value-number));  }
00083   sat_uint16 operator/(const double     number) { return clamp(int(value/number));  }
00084   sat_uint16 operator/(const int        number) { return clamp(value/number);       }
00085 
00086   //! Convert to an integer and compare.
00087   const int operator== (const int number)        const { return (number==value); }
00088   const int operator!= (const int number)        const { return (number!=value); }
00089   // these make it ambiguous -- arent clear they are needed.
00090   //const int operator== (const sat_uint16 number) const { return (int(number)==int(value); }
00091   //const int operator!= (const sat_uint16 number) const { return (number!=value); }
00092 
00093   const int operator<   (const int number) const { return (number< value);  }
00094   const int operator>   (const int number) const { return (number> value);  }
00095   const int operator<=  (const int number) const { return (number<=value);  }
00096   const int operator>=  (const int number) const { return (number>=value);  }
00097 
00098   //! almost standard inc/dec operators
00099   sat_uint16& operator++(int ignored) { if (value<SAT_UINT16_MAX) { value++; } ; return *this; }
00100   sat_uint16& operator--(int ignored) { if (0<value) { value--; }; return *this; }
00101   
00102   //
00103   sat_uint16& operator+=(const int number) { assign(value+number); return *this; }
00104 
00105   //! cast to different formats
00106   operator int()      const { return value;         }
00107   operator uint64_t() const { return value;         }
00108   operator float()    const { return float(value);  }
00109   operator double()   const { return double(value); }
00110 };
00111 
00112 #endif // __SAT_UINT16_H_
